comment.narrative: 1. Belarus ensures regular reporting of climate change related trends and developments in the form of national communications, as part of its commitments under UNFCCC. 2. The Party’s main policy framework relating to energy and climate change is the National Programme on Climate Change Mitigation Measures for 2013–2020. Key policies supporting the climate change goals of Belarus include the National Strategy for Sustainable Socioeconomic Development of the Republic of Belarus until 2030, and the Environmental Strategy of the Republic of Belarus until 2025. The mitigation actions with the most significant mitigation impact are the State program "Energy Saving" for 2016-2020 and the sub-program "Development of the use of local fuel and energy resources, including renewable energy sources". 3. The Project main partners/beneficiaries, as well as target group representatives are involved in the Inter-agency working group on climate change issues of the MNREP (18 members) and the Public Environmental Coordinating Council (23 representatives of NGOs). 4. Belarus successfully prepared and submitted to UNFCCC seven National Communications and two Biennial Reports.

1. National circumstances, institutional arrangements is prepared and submitted to the MNREP. 2. National report with the result of GHG inventory is submitted to MNREP for futher policy making. 3. Climate change mitigation and system for the measurement, reporting and verification (MRV) basis developed and recommentdations on low-carbon development of the Republic of Belarus until 2050 is prepared. 4. Plan for the effective implementation of measures to adapt to climate change is submitted to the MNREP. 5. The Seventh National Communication and the Third Biennial Report submitted to MNREP

The results of the analysis was included in Section 8 Surveys and Systematic Observation in the Field of Climate Change of the draft NC 7. Final report containing projections of emissions and sinks for the LULUCF sector in the part of the forestry up to 2050 considering the measures to enhance GHG removals by sinks in LULUCF sector was prepared. Final report containing the collection and processing of information for the greenhouse gas inventory database according to the data from the National Statistical Committee for the LULUCF sector was prepared. Final reports containing national greenhouse gas emission factors for various wetlands (in particular for developing and developed peat deposits) were prepared. Final reports containing the data of changes in carbon stocks of soils and re-waterlogged peatlands were prepared. Interim reports had been prepared, including proposals for establishing updated emission factors for key sources categories: Energy, Industrial processes and use of products, Agriculture, Wastewater Treatment. Final report had been prepared, containing activities order on updating of the system of inventory of sources and ways of handling wastes of production, consumption and municipal waste. Reference document has been prepared, containing updated emission factors. Interim reports had been prepared, including activity data for updating the GHG inventory Data Base, as well as analisis of gaps in data by sectors: Energy, Industrial processes and use of products, Waste, Agriculture, LULUCF. The results of the analysis were included in the draft section 4 Policies and measures in the field of climate change of the draft NC 7 of the Republic of Belarus. Proposals for improving the legal framework was submitted to the MNREP. Draft of the Strategy for long-term development of the Republic of Belarus with low greenhouse gas emissions for the period up to 2050 has been developed, including the following sections: General provisions; Goals and Objectives of the Strategy; Current state of greenhouse gas emissions by industry (main sources of greenhouse gas emissions; factors affecting the dynamics of greenhouse gas emissions; actions to prevent climate change and their impact; key development issues and priorities); Forecasts of greenhouse gas emissions until 2050; List of measures for the transition to low-carbon climate sustainable development; Target indicators; Monitoring the implementation of the strategy. International consultant prepared suggestions for long-term GHG emissions reduction in the main sectors of national economy, such as, energy engineering, industry, transport, construction, agriculture, forestry, wastes, etc. and recommendations on the draft of the low-carbon development Strategy of the Republic of Belarus until 2050. A study had been carried out on the possibilities of applying in the Republic of Belarus the economic mechanisms stipulated under the Paris Agreement. An interim report had been prepared, taking into account the fact that in 2021 an organization will be hired to study the possibilities of introducing an internal emission trading system in the Republic of Belarus and using market mechanisms for these purposes. The results of the study are included in the draft section 4 Policies and measures in the field of climate change of the draft NC 7. An interim report had been prepared containing the results of evaluating information about the National Register of Carbon Units of the Republic of Belarus, the experience of other countries in the development and maintenance of the Carbon Units Register, as well as conclusions and recommendations regarding the possibility of functioning and structure of the National Register of Carbon Units of the Republic of Belarus. 1. The needs and problems arising from climate change are analyzed with engagement of international consultant. Report containing the results of analysis of the needs and problems arising from climate change is prepared. 2. The Analysis of the international experience of the national inventory was provided. The suggestions on improvement of the GHG inventory system in the Republic of Belarus and Drafts of technical regulations on GHG emissions determination are developed. Drafts of legislation acts on improvement of GHG emissions information collection is developed and submitted to the decision maker bodies. Final version of GHG inventory for all sectors of the economy required by IPCC on the basis of improved information is prepared with engagement of international consultant. The roadmap for the GHG inventory improvement prepared by international consultant were provided to the RUE Bel Research Center Ecology for the implementation. 3. Recommendations for addressing climate change in standards harmonized with international guideline ISO Guide 84:2020 are developed. (I) Draft of technical regulation harmonized with international standard ISO 14064-3:2020 and determining the guidance for the validation and verification of greenhouse gas assertions is developed. (II) Draft of technical regulation harmonized with international standard ISO 14067:2018 and determining the requirements and guidelines for quantification of carbon footprint of products is developed. (III) Draft of technical regulation harmonized with international standard ISO 14080:2018 and determining the framework and principles for methodologies on climate actions is developed. (IV) Draft of technical regulation harmonized with international standard ISO 14065:2020 and determining the requirements for greenhouse gas validation and verification bodies for use in accreditation or other forms of recognition is developed. (V) Draft of technical regulation harmonized with international standard ISO 14066:2011 and determining the competence requirements for greenhouse gas validation teams and verification teams is developed. The international experience on the development of the system for monitoring, reporting and verifying is conducted. Draft of the Plan for the implementation of a system for monitoring, reporting and verifying GHG emissions in the Republic of Belarus is developed. Draft of the Strategy for long-term development of the Republic of Belarus with low greenhouse gas emissions for the period up to 2050 has been developed, including the following sections: General provisions; Goals and Objectives of the Strategy; Current state of greenhouse gas emissions by industry (main sources of greenhouse gas emissions; factors affecting the dynamics of greenhouse gas emissions; actions to prevent climate change and their impact; key development issues and priorities); Forecasts of greenhouse gas emissions until 2050; List of measures for the transition to low-carbon climate sustainable development; Target indicators; Monitoring the implementation of the strategy. International consultant is hired. International consultant will analyze the International experience of low-carbon development. The general framework of Draft of the low-carbon development Strategy of the Republic of Belarus until 2050 presented on the Council of Sustainable Development Meeting. Terms of reference are prepared for the selection of the company, the biddings are organized and the company is selected, contract is awarded for the Investigation of the possibilities of implementing an internal emissions trading system in the Republic of Belarus and using market mechanisms for these purposes. Investigation of the possibilities of implementing an internal emissions trading system in the Republic of Belarus and using market mechanisms for these purposes is done. The report containing the results of investigation of the possibilities of implementing an internal emissions trading system in the Republic of Belarus and using market mechanisms for these purposes, including the rules of allowance determination, distribution of allowance, emissions trading, procedures of distribution, circulation and redemption of the carbon units is prepared. The international consultant developed the recommendations on the carbon regulation in the Republic of Belarus taking into account the Green Deal of EU. The presentation on the improvement of carbon regulation in the Russian Federation taking into account the EU Green Deal presented on the meeting pf the First international exhibition and Forum EcologyEXPO-2021 and seminar on the carbon regulation. For the development of The roadmap for the implementation of carbon regulation measures in the Republic of Belarus taking into account the Green Deal were: -determined the significant goods of the belarusian export fall within the scope of the Carbon border adjustment mechanism; - provided the assessment of the goods export volume (total and in the EU) in 2018 - 2020; - provided the assessment of the carbon factors and proportion between rate of the goods under CBAM and total export volume; - provided the assessment of the lost of the belarusian exporter after CBAM coming into force; - provided the review of national legislation with assessment of capabilities and/or barriers for the carbon regulation improvement in the Republic of Belarus; - provided the general analysis of the CBAM influence on the energy and industry sectors; - provided the analysis of potential of the Republic of Belarus in the forest carbon projects; - developed the road map on the improvement of carbon regulation in the Republic of Belarus (with an indication of a measures, responsible parties, deadlines, brief justification) relating to general organizational and legislative measures, measures for the energy and industrial sectors. Terms of reference are prepared for the selection of the company, the biddings are organized and the company is selected, contract is awarded for Adjustment of the Register of Carbon Units of the Republic of Belarus. Concept of creation, adjustment anf implementation of the national Register of Carbon Units of the Republic of Belarus as a basic component of the Emissions Trading System is developed. 4. Analysis of climate changes impact on the social and economic development of the Republic of Belarus with assessment of the vulnerability of agriculture, forestry, water supply, biodiversity and development of corresponding adaptation measures is done. The analysis of international experience for the preparation of the Adaptation Communications is done. The technical regulations on climate change adaptation are developed. Analysis of international experience on adaptation of agriculture to climate change is done. Report prepared by international consultant contains the impact assessment of climate change on the agriculture in the EU, basis for the development and implementation of the adaptation measures in the EU, recommendations on the Action Plan for the Implementation of the National Strategy of the Republic of Belarus on adaptation of agriculture to climate change. Analysis of the preparation of the gender responsive National Communications with engagement of international consultant is done. The report containing the analysis of gender responsive provisions of the international documents on climate change issues, reflection of the gender aspects in the national communications Annex 1 Countries and recommendations on gender responsive National communication preparation in the Republic of Belarus is prepared. 5. Draft of the Seventh National Communication contain the all prepared during the project sections is compiled, edited and reviewed by members of Interdepartmental Working Group on Climate Change. The main issues of the Draft of National Communication presented on the Public Coordination Environmental Council on 31.03.2021.Draft of the National Communication submitted to the MNREP. Audit of the project implementation by the State Enterprise Ecologyinvest under HACT modality is conducted 2 times in 2021 by the third party service hired by UNDP provider.Financial audit of the project is conducted. Results of the audit are taken into account during the project implementation by PMU and implementing partner. Project staff works in accordance with Project Document, Annual Detailed Work Plan 2020 and Outcome 5 activities are implemented without substantial delay (20% Project Manager, 20% Financial and Administrative Assistant).
